001package com.technototes.vision.hardware;
002
003import com.technototes.library.hardware.DummyDevice;
004import org.openftc.easyopencv.OpenCvCameraFactory;
005import org.openftc.easyopencv.OpenCvInternalCamera;
006
007/**
008 * This is a Camera for use with a phone's internal camera
009 */
010@SuppressWarnings("unused")
011public class InternalCamera
012    extends Camera<OpenCvInternalCamera, DummyDevice<OpenCvInternalCamera.CameraDirection>> {
013
014    /**
015     * Create the front-facing internal camera
016     */
017    public InternalCamera() {
018        this(OpenCvInternalCamera.CameraDirection.FRONT);
019    }
020
021    /**
022     * Create a camera (using the one on the phone for the CameraDirection)
023     *
024     * @param dir The direction (FRONT or REAR, probably)
025     */
026    public InternalCamera(OpenCvInternalCamera.CameraDirection dir) {
027        super(new DummyDevice<>(dir));
028        createCamera();
029    }
030
031    /**
032     * Get which internal camera is being used
033     *
034     * @return FRONT or REAR, probably (TODO)
035     */
036    public OpenCvInternalCamera.CameraDirection getCameraDirection() {
037        return getDevice().get();
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * Create an OpenCvInternalCamera from this Camera
042     *
043     * @return the OpenCvInternalCamera device
044     */
045    @Override
046    public OpenCvInternalCamera createCamera() {
047        return OpenCvCameraFactory
048            .getInstance()
049            .createInternalCamera(
050                getCameraDirection(),
051                hardwareMap.appContext
052                    .getResources()
053                    .getIdentifier(
054                        "cameraMonitorViewId",
055                        "id",
056                        hardwareMap.appContext.getPackageName()
057                    )
058            );
059    }
060}
